documents.title: could tomorrow be the warmest december day on record ?
text: it 's possible that we may have the warmest december day on record on wednesday .
we have to beat 16c set on 11 december 1984 in county down .

documents.title: man jailed over semtex in run-up to royal visit
text: a 25-year-old dissident republican has been jailed in dublin for five years .
donal ó coisdealbha from killester , north dublin , was arrested on explosive charges in the run-up to the visit of prince charles to ireland in 2015 .
ó coisdealbha admitted to the dublin 's special criminal court that he was a dissident republican .

documents.title: why are people less keen to donate eyes ?
text: of the hundreds of thousands of people who agree to donate organs every year , there is often one sticking point - their eyes .
while relatives will sign away a loved one 's heart or a kidney , they are more reluctant to give their eyes , said belfast opthalmic surgeon david frazer .

documents.title: arrests in coleraine as part of drugs probe
text: police arrest 2 suspects in coleraine as part of an ongoing investigation into the supply of drugs in north west .

documents.title: ni attorney general appears before uk 's supreme court
text: northern ireland attorney general john larkin has told the uk supreme court that the consent principle enshrined in the good friday agreement is `` entirely and exclusively about the status of northern ireland within the uk '' .

he said that this clearly negated one of the key arguments made by victims campaigner raymond mccord in his case that the people of northern ireland should be consulted before the uk government triggers article 50 .

documents.title: delays on a2 towards holywood
text: a bump on the slip road from # holywood exchange ( where it joins a2 ) is blocking part of the road adding to the usual delays towards holywood

documents.title: september start for ni universal credit
text: the universal credit ( uc ) benefit will start being paid in northern ireland from september 2017 , with full implementation due the following september .
uc replaces tax credits , jobseeker 's allowance , income support , employment support allowance and housing benefit .

documents.title: fm/dfm announce names on 'fresh start ' panel
text: the first minister and deputy first minister have announced the names of a six-person panel which was promised in the fresh start agreement .
the panel will consider specific strategic issues relevant to the programme for government and report to the executive .
the panel members are peter bunting , julie andrews , marie cavanagh , hilary singleton , majella mccloskey and janet williamson .

documents.title: flood protection work may not go ahead
text: a county tyrone village devastated by storm desmond may not get new flood defences because of a lack of funds .
a number of homes and businesses in clady were flooded after the storm last december .
an initial study was carried out to replace a damaged floodwall and flood-banks but david porter from the rivers agency said progressing that work was now subject to `` the availability of funds '' .

documents.title: woman dies after being given wrong pills
text: an `` overworked '' pharmacist made a tragic error and gave out the wrong pills to a grandmother who became ill within minutes and later died , a court has heard .
martin white , 45 , of belfast road , muckamore , county antrim , admitted giving the wrong prescription to ethna walsh , 67 , on 6 february 2014 .

documents.title: ni civil service unions agree 1 % pay rise
text: ni civil service unions have agreed 1 % pay rise ( on top of pay scale progression ) .
also minimum admin salary up from £ 16,300 to £ 17,352 .
friendly reminder that uk cpi inflation is forecast to be 2 % - 3 % next year
this is only deal for non-industrial civil service - industrial civil service negotiations still ongoing .

documents.title: dublin shooting victim critically ill
text: a man who was shot several times in dublin on monday night is now in a critical condition in hospital .
the attack happened at parlickstown green , mulhuddart .
at about 20:30 local time .

documents.title: ni teens 'slightly better than global average '
text: fifteen year olds in northern ireland have performed slightly better than the global average in international tests in maths , reading and science .
the results were recorded in pisa tests run by the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) .

documents.title: child sexual abuse claims linked with ni football clubs
text: a `` small number '' of allegations of non-recent child sexual abuse linked to northern ireland football clubs have been received by police .
a spokesperson for the psni said : `` we work closely with all of the sporting bodies to ensure effective safeguarding is in place '' .

documents.title: man hospitalised by gang with hammers , say police
text: a man in his 20s has been hospitalised after an attack by a gang with hammers , police say .
it happened on friendly street in belfast at about 3pm on sunday .
the victim was taken to hospital for treatment to his injuries , which are not believed to be life threatening .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: raising a family in a hostel

we 've spoken to some women who live with their families in a hostel because of homelessness and know exactly how difficult it is .

documents.title: mcgurk 's bar bombing families 'to reveal cover-up evidence '
text: the families of the victims of the mcgurk 's bar bomb are holding an event to reveal what they say is evidence backing their claims of a cover-up by the government and the ruc .
fifteen people were killed in the ulster volunteer force bombing of the north belfast bar in december 1971 .

documents.title: how does ni education measure up ?
text: later this morning it 'll be revealed how post-primary pupils in northern ireland have performed in international tests in maths reading and science .
the programme for international student assessment tests , run by the organisation for economic co-operation and development , has become the most influential ranking in international education .
the tests are taken by over half a million pupils in around 70 countries .

documents.title: mist and fog warning this morning
text: possibility of mist and fog this morning .
road users should exercise caution when travelling .

documents.title: eu customs union 'should be post-brexit priority '
text: the ni executive should make staying in the eu customs union a post-brexit priority , according to a think tank .
the uk will have to decide if it leaves the customs union when it leaves the eu .
that would mean goods moving between the uk and the eu would be subject to customs procedures and tariffs .
author: John Campbell
BBC News NI Economics and Business Editor

text: the milder air has arrived - with it comes some rain and a blustery wind .

documents.title: carbon monoxide detected in house where man died
text: a man in his 70s has died in lurgan , county armagh , after carbon monoxide was detected in his home .
the fire service were called to the albert street house shortly before 22:00 gmt on sunday and found the man 's body .

documents.title: guns n ' roses to make return to island
text: they 're coming back - 25 years since their last irish gig , @ twitterid are to play slane castle .
hear more on # breakfast after 0730

documents.title: abortion bill begins ni assembly passage
text: former justice minister david ford 's abortion bill is to begin its passage through the northern ireland assembly later .
the private bill seeks to legalise abortion in cases of fatal foetal abnormalities .
if passed , it would enable women in that situation to access a legal termination in northern ireland .

text: morning peops .

documents.title: man charged with attempted murder
text: a 30-year-old man has been charged with attempted murder after a woman was critically injured in downpatrick , county down .
the incident happened at a house in thomas russell park in the town on friday .
